file_content.text: Now the Empire's rewarding the killers with parties and medals. They're celebrating in plain sight--taunting us before they're shipped back home.
I won't give up until we push the Empire off Corellia forever.
I knew you were destined for greatness when we first met on Tython. It's an honor to serve with you.
I've seen so many Jedi fall since war came to Corellia. The order needs your leadership, Supreme Commander.
When you saved my life as a Padawan, I dedicated myself to becoming the best Jedi I could be. I'll prove that to you.
These Jedi from the Outer Rim are inexperienced and frightened. Don't ask too much of them.
Gentlebeings, please. This arguing solves nothing.
There shouldn't be any argument. The Republic is here to save the people of Corellia--period.
We're here to win a war, Senator. What good is saving lives if we lose the blasted planet?
The Jedi have come to rescue Corellia's people and free their world from the Empire.
Saving lives is what we do.
If only everyone felt that way.
What's going on here? Who are you people?
Back up and start over.
There will always be casualties in war. We have to pick our targets carefully.
Good point.
The Jedi supreme commander understands what's at stake much better than you.
The colonel reports to General Var Suthra. This Senator is a leader of Corellia's government. They both want our help.
The Empire sent extermination patrols to our medical evacuation sites. Those murdering scum slaughtered our wounded.
We need to strike back before that filth leaves Corellia. Put some fear in the Empire!
I won't make any decisions without hearing the Senator's request.
Let's hear from the Senator.
Answering one war crime with another? What will that prove?
Two wrongs don't make a right.
It'll show the Imperials they can't kill our wounded and get away with it. They need that message in no uncertain terms.
It would be nice to see the Empire shaking in its jackboots.
I like your style.
You have my sympathies for your losses, but what's done is done. We must focus on the people we can still save.
Thousands of Corellian citizens are being kidnapped and forced to serve the Empire. We have to free them!
Those "citizens" are being "kidnapped" from your prisons! They're criminals!
No. They're in custody awaiting trial. They are innocent until proven guilty, and we cannot abandon them to the enemy.
Innocent or guilty, they're still Republic citizens. I won't let the Empire have them.
I agree.
Which mission would make the best use of our people?
What do you think, Unaw?
Jedi fight their hardest when they have a goal they can believe in. Revenge is not our way.
Morale is lower since the last mission. Our people need a victory they can believe in.
There's a reason they're locked up. Why should I care what happens to them?
Sure we can.
Many were simply in the wrong place at the wrong time. If not for this war, they might have been released already.
Supreme Commander, we've received advanced combat gear from Balmorra. If you commit men to my cause, we'll equip you to better face the enemy.
That's outrageous! You're attempting to bribe this Jedi.
That is insulting and incorrect, Senator. I'm adding to the supreme commander's knowledge. The final decision is hers.
That is insulting and incorrect, Senator. I'm adding to the supreme commander's knowledge. He'll make the final call.
We're saving the civilians.
Your revenge will have to wait, Colonel. I'm committing all my forces to rescuing the civilians.
I'm siding with the Senator.
Thank you! I'll provide coordinates to the Imperial slave camps. We'll have transports standing by to evacuate our people once they're free.
I will communicate your orders to our people right away.
The general said you were here to help us. I was misinformed.
I was already planning to commit all my forces to your mission, Colonel--but I accept your offer.
Those Imperials need to die.
I can't believe you! I'm filing a complaint to the Supreme Chancellor!
I have coordinates to the Imperial camps where the extermination squads are celebrating. Let's shut those parties down.
Wish I could get surveillance holos to record this. It'd boost morale.
Our science advisor is waiting for you. He has information on that rogue Jedi you're after.
The hero of Tython... you're a welcome sight!
The people here let me use their home as a base of operations. An Imperial spy discovered us.
The Empire came to execute these civilians for helping a Jedi. You saved many innocent lives.
The Emperor wants everyone on Corellia dead. I'm here to stop that.
I need to save more.
Tell me how I can help. You're the reason I'm a Jedi Knight.
I get the feeling we've met before.
You seem familiar.
I'm honored you remember. Our last meeting was a long time ago.
You saved me from a dark Jedi in the Padawan training grounds on Tython.
He captured me in a cave tunnel. I would have died if you hadn't stopped him.
Maybe we have a destiny to defeat the Empire together.
The Force is still with us.
If that's true, I'm ready to do what we must.
I need your mind in the here and now. There's a war to win.
Focus on the present.
I am centered and ready to do as you command.
This is twice I've pulled your hide out of the fire. Don't count on a third.
I won't be saving you again.
I'm not a Padawan anymore. I accept full responsibility for my life--or death.
Just follow my orders.
I'm taking charge of all Jedi forces. We're rallying reinforcements at these coordinates. Go.
With the hero of Tython leading us, I know we'll be victorious.
Never told me you were so famous, beautiful.
Think he's got a little hero worship going.
Why does everyone forget about me? Wait, is he talking about the first time you saved Tython, or the second?
Obedient to the point of self-sacrifice. Good.
That's the spirit, soldier.
T7 = also hero of Tython // Organics = never mention this
See you at the rally coordinates!
You serve with the hero of Tython. That is a tremendous honor.
A ray shield... we're cut off! What now?
They can't do any more good here. The ship's a death trap.
They're badly outnumbered. Who knows how many Sith are on this cruiser?
They're shock troops. Use them.
General Var Suthra needs all the help he can get.
Jedi + T7 = on our own // Strike team = retreat
There must be something we can do.
You've done all you can here. Retreat to the base.
Fall back, Unaw.
Let's turn this to our advantage. Find a gunnery station and target Imperial forces on the surface. General Var Suthra needs the extra firepower.
Bombard enemies on the ground.
There are still enemies aboard this vessel. They could trap us in that gunnery station. Kill us all.
I hadn't thought of that. You'd better fall back to the base.
Good point. Retreat, instead.
May the Force be with you.
One of you can operate the gunnery station while the other two keep the Sith at bay. We have to do this.
Take the risk.
Don't question my orders. Move it!
I'm supreme commander here!
May the Force be with us.
I'll handle the reactors. Clear every enemy still aboard. We're claiming this vessel for the Republic.
Kill everyone on this ship.
We'll do our best, Supreme Commander.
So far, so good. No sign of enemies.
That didn't last long.
Our forces are still in action out there. We'll regroup everyone and wait for your orders.
May the Force be with you, Supreme Commander.
I sealed the fuel leak and repaired the repulsorlift engines. The shuttle is ready to fly.
Let's take out that second turbolaser.
Right on schedule.
You're a Jedi of many talents, my friend.
Good work, Unaw.
Everyone will be shooting at us this time. I recommend flying aggressively.
If we have a burnout, I'll know who to blame.
We'll see about that.
It will get us to our destination. More than that, I cannot guarantee.
The shuttle's repulsorlift engines are damaged, and we've got a bad fuel leak. We're lucky there's no fire.
If this shuttle blows, we're stuck here.
This is our only transport.
Doctor Godera said we would appear to be Imperial. What happened?
Why did we get shot?
We took fire from Republic artillery. I guess we fooled them, too.
Blowing up our transport could make for a good diversion.
Let's destroy the shuttle.
There is no guarantee we'll find another way out of here. We need this transport intact.
I can fix it, but I need time. You'll have to destroy that turbolaser without me.
I'll handle the turbolaser. You keep us flying.
No problem, Unaw.
My droid can repair the shuttle. I want you with me.
Teeseven will do it.
T7 = expert repair droid // Repulsorlift engines = running before you return
Lead the way, Supreme Commander. May the Force be with us.
What happens if an enemy patrol comes here to investigate?
You'll be alright alone?
I suspect they will be much more interested in you, Supreme Commander.
At least if you're here, you won't be getting in my way.
I don't need you anyway.
I wasn't aware I'd become an impediment. The next time we fight together, I will remain behind you.
I'll have the shuttle fixed by the time you're back. May the Force be with you.
This shuttle is in excellent condition. Let's hope it stays that way.
We're ready to fly when you are, Supreme Commander.
We only have four squads, but the enemy probably won't be expecting us. Let's hope that is enough.
Five squads should be enough to achieve this objective.
The enemy should pose little threat to six squads of Jedi.
Both of these objectives have merit. We'll divide our forces. One group will attack the Imperials. The rest will free the civilians.
[Send forces on both missions]
The more forces you commit to my mission, the more advanced combat gear I can requisition for you.
All six squads are standing by. How many should I send to attack the Imperials?
The slaves camps should be lightly guarded. Send the bulk of our people after the Imperials.
Send five squads.
I don't want either mission failing. Divide our forces evenly.
Send three squads.
Civilians are our top priority. Dispatch one squad to teach the Imperials a lesson.
Send one squad.
We're down to five squads. How many do you want attacking the Imperials?
I want most of our squads teaching the Imperials a lesson.
Send four squads.
I want to avenge our people, but saving civilian lives is our higher priority.
Send two squads.
The rescue operation will be trickier. Commit the bulk of our forces to that.
Send one squad.
We only have four squads left. How many should we send to attack the Imperials?
The Imperials must pay for what they've done. Send the majority of our people there.
Send three squads.
A lone squad won't succeed on either mission. Divide our forces evenly.
Send two squads.
Saving the civilians is our priority. Put the majority of our people on that.
Send one squad.
I will communicate your orders immediately and coordinate our efforts with the Senator and the colonel.
I'll arrange for rescue transports to evacuate our people once they're free.
I was hoping you'd commit everything to my mission, but I'll take what I can get.
Dividing our forces again would be a mistake. I recommend we focus on freeing the civilians.
The Sith have sabotaged this factory. Getting to the control room won't be easy.
We're ready to move when you are. May the Force protect us.
Ready to move on your signal, Supreme Commander.
The hero of Tython will defeat you!
You will face justice!
The Empire will never take Corellia!
You brought this on yourselves!
You get one chance to surrender!
For the Republic! For the Jedi!
We will never surrender!
This is for every innocent life you've taken!
